Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 6/13/2017 at 9:36 AM, V8jester said:
> 
> 
> **IR for 1.3 / KJR issues**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> List of IR download files to work with KSP 1.3
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Remove "Active struts" as well as "strut" Folders" they are currently incompatible with KSP 1.3 - Unless you opt to use the unofficial Recompiled .dll linked below**
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Steps to install Infernal Robotics
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 1) Install Core Download which is the plugin and "core Files" of IR  (No parts are in this download)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 2) Install Parts Pack (Legacy is the original parts, and Rework are the new white parts. You can have both installed if you wish)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 3) Remove folders "IRActiveStruts" and "Struts" as they are currently incompatible
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 4) **Optional** -  If you wish to use the Surface sampler - Install the Surfacesampler.dll linked below into GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework\_Utility/Plugins
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 5) **Optional**  - KJR unofficial recompile will work with KSP 1.3 and IR 2.0.12 - Linked below
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 6) **Optional** - <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> Magnet / Grasper Breaking? Increase "breakForce" under the <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> module in the part cfg to "= 999"
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 7) **Optional** - Unofficial recompile of Active Struts Plugin linked below. Curtesy of Whale\_2
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Core Download**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Infernal Robotics (Ziw) 2.0.12
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases</font>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases)
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Parts / Plugin**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Legacy Parts (Ziw)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip</font></u>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> IR Rework Parts (Zodiusinfuser) **<font color="#e74c3c">- See Active Struts notes above</font>**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [<u><font color="#0066cc">https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw</font></u>](https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw) **** 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Surface Sampler dll (DMagic) **- Place into "MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework\_Utility/Plugins"**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins</font>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Active Struts Plugin Unofficial Recompile (Whale\_2)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [https://github.com/whale2/Active-Struts/releases/tag/1.1.0-1](https://github.com/whale2/Active-Struts/releases/tag/1.1.0-1)
> 

I just tried to download these file but Windows Defender marked the IRSurfaceSampler.dll as - Trojan:Win32/Spursint.F!c

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-18T15:19:13Z" title="07/18/2017 03:19  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 18, 2017</time> by badfrogg**

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, badfrogg said:
> 
> 
> I just tried to download these file but Windows Defender marked the IRSurfaceSampler.dll as - Trojan:Win32/Spursint.F!c
> 

That's because it is a .dll file. Most antivirus programs don't like it when you download a .dll. They typically flag them as a virus. I can tell you I am using the file from this download with no issues.

> 
> 
> On 13.6.2017 at 3:36 PM, V8jester said:
> 
> 
> **Kerbal Joint Reinforcement**
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Official GitHub Repository (Ferram4) - [<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement/releases</font>](https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement/releases)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Unofficial Recompile For 1.3 (siimav) - [<font color="#0066cc">https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxowaRaYHkjddHc2T28zWEdLcjQ/view</font>](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxowaRaYHkjddHc2T28zWEdLcjQ/view)
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Please feel free to repost / update this list every so often to help a lot of the new comers
> 
> 
> 
> 
> **Edited July 13 by V8jester**
> 

Because of this

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50911-13-kerbal-joint-reinforcement-v333-72417/&do=embed&comment=3129400&embedComment=3129400&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

and this

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50911-13-kerbal-joint-reinforcement-v333-72417/&do=embed&comment=3129779&embedComment=3129779&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

I guess it's all working now?

How do get things to mirror movement without placing them separately? For instance, I have a plane with rotating engine nozzles a la Harrier. The nozzles I placed in pairs, but when selecting next or previous preset, both sides move in different directions instead of the same direction.

> 
> 
> 7 minutes ago, Cdodders said:
> 
> 
> How do get things to mirror movement without placing them separately? For instance, I have a plane with rotating engine nozzles a la Harrier. The nozzles I placed in pairs, but when selecting next or previous preset, both sides move in different directions instead of the same direction.
> 

You have option on each moving IR part to invert direction. Sorry, don't recall from top of my head exact name on part right click menu in <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr>/<abbr title="Vehicle Assembly Building">VAB</abbr>.

Is there a list some where of all the parts in IR? I only seem to have a few rework parts and Legacy ones.

One post above yours dude......

I only have these reworked parts: grabber, grasper, landing foot, robotics control unit, the roboathlete trusses, Grappler, struts, and robostrut target. I looked at the Magic smoke files and there it shows the other parts but in game  I only see the those parts I listed. Help?

Is there any chance of this being bundled into an actual single, working, release for 1.3.x?  what is stopping this from happening? This is pretty fragmented and hackish as it is.  Then again, that's the Kerbal way ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif ":wink:")

The team of guys that built IR. Has become a bit thin. [@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/) and [@ZodiusInfuser](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/76163-zodiusinfuser/) are really the two core guys that have stuck around. But even they have been scaling back over time. The only thing that usually breaks with an update is the plugin of a mod. Parts are typically unaffected (not completely the case with IR, an example would be RKE)

The closest we are all currently is my compiled list of downloads. But IR has honestly been a conglomerate of downlods for quite some time now.

I have taken out activestruts, and it works, so I did follow the instructions. What is <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>?
I had taken out active struts otherwise it would crash so instructions yes, but what is <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>?

Getting parts but no interface and have tried all the steps above. Not crashing because I've removed the active struts folder and struts folders as instructed, what am I missing? I get no interface for infernal robotics when either right clicking the parts or on the toolbars.

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-30T06:27:25Z" title="07/30/2017 06:27  AM" data-short="6 yr">July 30, 2017</time> by Maelstrom Vortex**

This is <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> (Module Manager) You need this for almost every mod in KSP

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/50533-130-module-manager-281-june-29th-2017-with-n-cats-physics/&do=embed"></iframe>

Trust me, If you fallowed "all" my instructions. all the links are current as well as functional in 1.3

**IR for 1.3 / KJR issues**

List of IR download files to work with KSP 1.3

**Remove "Active struts" as well as "strut" Folders" they are currently incompatible with KSP 1.3 - Unless you opt to use the unofficial Recompiled .dll linked below**

Steps to install Infernal Robotics

1) Install Core Download which is the plugin and "core Files" of IR  (No parts are in this download)

2) Install Parts Pack (Legacy is the original parts, and Rework are the new white parts. You can have both installed if you wish)

3) Remove folders "IRActiveStruts" and "Struts" as they are currently incompatible

4) **Optional** -  If you wish to use the Surface sampler - Install the Surfacesampler.dll linked below into GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework\_Utility/Plugins

5) **Optional**  - KJR unofficial recompile will work with KSP 1.3 and IR 2.0.12 - Linked below

6) **Optional** - <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> Magnet / Grasper Breaking? Increase "breakForce" under the <abbr title="Kerbal Attachment System (mod)">KAS</abbr> module in the part cfg to "= 999"

7) **Optional** - Unofficial recompile of Active Struts Plugin linked below. Curtesy of Whale\_2

**Core Download**

Infernal Robotics (Ziw) 2.0.12

[<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases</font>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases)

**Parts / Plugin**

Legacy Parts (Ziw)

[<u><font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip</font></u>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/InfernalRobotics/releases/download/2.0.0/IR-LegacyParts.zip)

IR Rework Parts (Zodiusinfuser) **<font color="#e74c3c">- See Active Struts notes above</font>**

[<u><font color="#0066cc">https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw</font></u>](https://mega.nz/#!rdlHkLAJ!ZizDvd8s7zCIG529FtO8b7wM0avJ8yC3pldIaf6BGFw) **** 

Surface Sampler dll (DMagic) **- Place into "MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework\_Utility/Plugins"**

[<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins</font>](https://github.com/MagicSmokeIndustries/IR-Surface-Sampler/tree/master/GameData/MagicSmokeIndustries/Parts/Rework_Utility/Plugins)

Active Struts Plugin Unofficial Recompile (Whale\_2)

[https://github.com/whale2/Active-Struts/releases/tag/1.1.0-1](https://github.com/whale2/Active-Struts/releases/tag/1.1.0-1)

**Utility**

Thread Link For IR Sequencer (Ziw) 

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/104547-13-ir-sequencer-v103-add-on-to-infernal-robotics-updated-05062017/&do=embed&comment=3080938&embedComment=3080938&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

**Kerbal Joint Reinforcement**

Official GitHub Repository (Ferram4) - [<font color="#0066cc">https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement/releases</font>](https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement/releases)

Unofficial Recompile For 1.3 (siimav) - [<font color="#0066cc">https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxowaRaYHkjddHc2T28zWEdLcjQ/view</font>](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BxowaRaYHkjddHc2T28zWEdLcjQ/view)

Please feel free to repost / update this list every so often to help a lot of the new comers

Ok I think I need to update <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>. Is Struts the folder in Legacy parts? Also, is KJR a requirement for IR?

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-30T16:15:30Z" title="07/30/2017 04:15  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 30, 2017</time> by Kerbal Gamer**

> 
> 
> 34 minutes ago, Kerbal Gamer said:
> 
> 
> Ok I think I need to update <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>. Is Struts the folder in Legacy parts? Also, is KJR a requirement for IR?
> 

If you **do not** wish to use Active Struts. All you need to do is delete the folder "MagicSmokeIndustries/IRActiveStruts"

If you **do** wish to use Active Struts. Update the plugin "ActiveStruts.dll" in "MagicSmokeIndustries/IRActiveStruts/Plugins" with the one linked in my post from Whale\_2.

Also the current version of Module Manager is 2.8.1
